Salman Rushdie's stabber rejects plea deal involving terrorism charge with lesser jail term
content: Hadi Matar, the 26-year-old accused of stabbing author Salman Rushdie in 2022, has declined a plea deal on Tuesday that would have lowered his state prison sentence but could lead to a federal terrorism-related charge, according to his attorney, Nathaniel Barone. Matar remains in custody without bail following the attack that took place as Rushdie was preparing to speak at the Chautauqua Institution in western New York. Rushdie suffered significant injuries, including blindness in one eye and over a dozen stab wounds.
summary: Hadi Matar, the 26-year-old accused of stabbing author Salman Rushdie in 2022, has declined a plea deal on Tuesday that would have lowered his state prison sentence but could lead to a federal terrorism-related charge, according to his attorney, Nathaniel Barone. Matar remains in custody without bail following the attack that took place as Rushdie was preparing to speak at the Chautauqua Institution in western New York. Rushdie suffered significant injuries, including blindness in one eye and over a dozen stab wounds.

title: US to announce over $2.3 billion arms package for Ukraine, says defense secretary Austin
content: The United States is preparing to announce a new security assistance package for Ukraine worth over $2.3 billion. Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin revealed this during a meeting with his Ukrainian counterpart at the Pentagon. The package is in response to persistent calls from Ukrainian officials for more air defense systems due to frequent missile and drone attacks by Russian forces. The new package is expected to include anti-tank weapons, air defense interceptors, and expedited procurement of NASAMS and Patriot air defense interceptors.
summary: The United States is preparing to announce a new security assistance package for Ukraine worth over $2.3 billion. Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin revealed this during a meeting with his Ukrainian counterpart at the Pentagon. The package is in response to persistent calls from Ukrainian officials for more air defense systems due to frequent missile and drone attacks by Russian forces. The new package is expected to include anti-tank weapons, air defense interceptors, and expedited procurement of NASAMS and Patriot air defense interceptors.

title: 200 candidates withdraw from French poll to block far-right's win prospect
content: At least 200 candidates have exited the French election race to block the far-right party from gaining power, aiming to prevent the splitting of anti-right votes, reported news agency AFP. Marine Le Pen's RN emerged as the frontrunner in the first round of Sunday's snap election, surpassing President Emmanuel Macron's centrist camp, which finished in third place behind a left-wing alliance. Macron's decision to call the early election appears to have backfired. The RN's stance against further EU integration and its plans to reduce funding to the EU have raised concerns.
summary: At least 200 candidates have exited the French election race to block the far-right party from gaining power, aiming to prevent the splitting of anti-right votes, reported news agency AFP. Marine Le Pen's RN emerged as the frontrunner in the first round of Sunday's snap election, surpassing President Emmanuel Macron's centrist camp, which finished in third place behind a left-wing alliance. Macron's decision to call the early election appears to have backfired. The RN's stance against further EU integration and its plans to reduce funding to the EU have raised concerns.

title: Will Indian diaspora back Rishi Sunak in UK polls?
content: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak, who has often looked exhausted as he crossed the country during a six-week campaign, started the penultimate day of campaigning before Thursday's vote in a vast Ocado warehouse in Luton, north of London, watching robots pick items for delivery. Sunak, who shocked many in his party and the country when he called an election several months earlier than expected, has endured a tough campaign, facing questions from voters and journalists as to why the country is not in better shape.
summary: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak, who has often looked exhausted as he crossed the country during a six-week campaign, started the penultimate day of campaigning before Thursday's vote in a vast Ocado warehouse in Luton, north of London, watching robots pick items for delivery. Sunak, who shocked many in his party and the country when he called an election several months earlier than expected, has endured a tough campaign, facing questions from voters and journalists as to why the country is not in better shape.

title: 'Don't do something you might regret': UK PM's last request to voters ahead of general elections

UK court gives mixed ruling in Pfizer vs Moderna COVID vaccine patents case
content: London's High Court invalidated one of Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine technology patents, upheld another infringed by Pfizer and BioNTech's Comirnaty vaccine. Global legal battles continue as companies plan to appeal, ensuring vaccine production remains unaffected.
summary: London's High Court invalidated one of Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine technology patents, upheld another infringed by Pfizer and BioNTech's Comirnaty vaccine. Global legal battles continue as companies plan to appeal, ensuring vaccine production remains unaffected.

title: Fourth of July celebrations: Where to find the best fireworks in Los Angeles
content: As the fourth of July approaches, Los Angeles offers numerous prime locations to enjoy breathtaking fireworks. Popular spots include the Rose Bowl, Marina Del Rey, Disneyland, Hollywood Forever Cemetery, Long Beach, Huntington Beach, Universal Studios, and Hollywood Bowl. Each venue features unique celebrations, from soccer games and movie festivals to beach activities and patriotic-themed events, promising a spectacular Independence day experience.
summary: As the fourth of July approaches, Los Angeles offers numerous prime locations to enjoy breathtaking fireworks. Popular spots include the Rose Bowl, Marina Del Rey, Disneyland, Hollywood Forever Cemetery, Long Beach, Huntington Beach, Universal Studios, and Hollywood Bowl. Each venue features unique celebrations, from soccer games and movie festivals to beach activities and patriotic-themed events, promising a spectacular Independence day experience.

title: Wickremesinghe responds to critics on Sri Lanka's debt restructuring deal
content: Sri Lankan President Wickremesinghe addresses criticism of debt restructuring, emphasizing transparency and parliamentary scrutiny. Details include debt total, interest rates, and sustainable debt focus. The plan aims to resume projects, secure foreign loans, and address short-term credit assistance. Opposition leader Premadasa questions the government's approach to debt restructuring.
summary: Sri Lankan President Wickremesinghe addresses criticism of debt restructuring, emphasizing transparency and parliamentary scrutiny. Details include debt total, interest rates, and sustainable debt focus. The plan aims to resume projects, secure foreign loans, and address short-term credit assistance. Opposition leader Premadasa questions the government's approach to debt restructuring.

title: At UN meeting, Taliban asked to include women into public life
New Zealand to press ahead with media content pay law
content: New Zealand's proposed bill to compel digital platforms to pay media for news faces opposition from the ACT New Zealand party, needing support from other parties to pass. The Labour party is expected to support the bill, aligning with the intent to help local media companies earn revenue.
summary: New Zealand's proposed bill to compel digital platforms to pay media for news faces opposition from the ACT New Zealand party, needing support from other parties to pass. The Labour party is expected to support the bill, aligning with the intent to help local media companies earn revenue.

title: Indian-American physician pleads guilty to $2.4 million healthcare fraud scheme
content: Indian American physician Mona Ghosh pleaded guilty to federal healthcare fraud for billing Medicaid and private insurers for non-existent services through her clinic, Progressive Women's Healthcare. Facing up to ten years per count in federal prison, Ghosh admitted responsibility for over $1.5 million in fraudulent reimbursements. Sentencing is scheduled for October 22, with prosecutors alleging she orchestrated a scheme involving false claims and overstated medical services from 2018 to 2022.
summary: Indian American physician Mona Ghosh pleaded guilty to federal healthcare fraud for billing Medicaid and private insurers for non-existent services through her clinic, Progressive Women's Healthcare. Facing up to ten years per count in federal prison, Ghosh admitted responsibility for over $1.5 million in fraudulent reimbursements. Sentencing is scheduled for October 22, with prosecutors alleging she orchestrated a scheme involving false claims and overstated medical services from 2018 to 2022.

title: Indigenous ritual practiced for 12,000 years, study shows
content: For more than 10,000 years, people in a part of Australia practiced the same healing ritual. A new study has shown the ability of oral traditions to keep such practices alive across hundreds of generations. The discovery sheds light on the cultural practices of the Gunaikurnai people, and their healing rituals written down in the 19th century.
summary: For more than 10,000 years, people in a part of Australia practiced the same healing ritual. A new study has shown the ability of oral traditions to keep such practices alive across hundreds of generations. The discovery sheds light on the cultural practices of the Gunaikurnai people, and their healing rituals written down in the 19th century.

title: Hurricane Beryl, a Category 4 storm, pummels Caribbean islands, eyes Jamaica
content: Hurricane Beryl ripped off doors, windows and roofs in homes across the southeastern Caribbean on Monday after making landfall on the island of Carriacou as the earliest storm of Category 4 strength to form in the Atlantic, fueled by record warm waters. Beryl strengthened from a tropical depression to a major hurricane in just 42 hours â€” a feat accomplished only six other times in Atlantic hurricane history.
summary: Hurricane Beryl ripped off doors, windows and roofs in homes across the southeastern Caribbean on Monday after making landfall on the island of Carriacou as the earliest storm of Category 4 strength to form in the Atlantic, fueled by record warm waters. Beryl strengthened from a tropical depression to a major hurricane in just 42 hours â€” a feat accomplished only six other times in Atlantic hurricane history.

title: Jamie Foxx breaks silence on mysterious illness: 'I saw the tunnel'
content: Jamie Foxx's resilience and gratitude shine through as he navigates challenges, embracing life with renewed determination post-health scare. From 'In Living Color' to fatherhood, his journey underscores the preciousness of every moment, inspiring others to cherish life's opportunities with unwavering commitment and gratitude.

title: Why did the US judge call Karen Readâ€™s cop boyfriend murder 'mistrial'?
content: Karen Read's murder trial ended in a mistrial after jurors deadlocked. The retrial will proceed, with prosecutors accusing Read of second-degree murder, manslaughter, and fleeing the scene. The case involves allegations of hitting her boyfriend with an SUV and a focus on police procedures during the investigation.
summary: Karen Read's murder trial ended in a mistrial after jurors deadlocked. The retrial will proceed, with prosecutors accusing Read of second-degree murder, manslaughter, and fleeing the scene. The case involves allegations of hitting her boyfriend with an SUV and a focus on police procedures during the investigation.

title: Australian firms given six months to develop code to prevent children from seeing porn
content: Australia has given the internet industry six months to create an enforceable code to protect children from online pornography and other harmful content or face government-imposed regulations. The eSafety Commissioner demands a plan by October 3, covering age verification, parental controls, and content filtering. Google and Meta pledged cooperation, while representatives from X and Apple have yet to comment.
summary: Australia has given the internet industry six months to create an enforceable code to protect children from online pornography and other harmful content or face government-imposed regulations. The eSafety Commissioner demands a plan by October 3, covering age verification, parental controls, and content filtering. Google and Meta pledged cooperation, while representatives from X and Apple have yet to comment.
